meanings.definition: A loud cry or shout to attract attention.
meanings.sent1: The hilloas of the coachman alerted everyone to the approaching carriage.
meanings.sent2: I heard a hilloas from the crowd as the parade passed by.
meanings.sent3: The hilloas of the auctioneer echoed through the busy market.
meanings.sent4: Her hilloas for help pierced through the silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The hilloas of the lifeguard saved the drowning swimmer.

meanings.definition: To call out loudly or shout.
meanings.sent1: She hilloas for her lost dog every evening in the park.
meanings.sent2: The children hilloas with joy when they saw the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent3: He hilloas across the field to get his friend's attention.
meanings.sent4: The coach hilloas instructions to the players during the game.
meanings.sent5: The teacher hilloas the answer to the student at the back of the class.
